Class AVLTree

  • java.lang.Object
    • AVLTree

  • public class AVLTree
extends java.lang.Object
    AVL tree class for the use in the PowerAVLApp

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AVLTree()
      Costructor creates an new avl with root node equal to null

      • insert

        public void insert(PowerData d)
        This method adds data to a AVL tree. If the root is null it will make the data the root and add its children.
        Parameters:
        d - This is the data of type PowerData

      • insert

        public AVLTree.BinaryTreeNode insert(PowerData d,
                                     AVLTree.BinaryTreeNode node)
        Adds a new node to the current node by comparing its dateTime Value If the dateTime of d is smaller that the node's data datetime, node containing d will be added to the left of node. If the dateTime of d is greater that the node's data datetime, node containing d will be added to the right of node. add its children.
        Parameters:
        d - This is the data of type PowerData
        node - This is the node which the next data will be linked to.

      • find

        public PowerData find(java.lang.String s)
        This method looks for a string data in the AVL Tree
        Parameters:
        s - String data
        Returns:
        PowerData item

      • find

        public PowerData find(java.lang.String s,
                      AVLTree.BinaryTreeNode node)
        This method looks for a string data in the AVL Tree. It compares each node's data in the left and right sub trees until it finds a match.
        Parameters:
        s - String data
        node - Binary tree node
        Returns:
        PowerData item
